iso_cellular_organism_social.definition: Isomorphic patterns across cellular, organismal, and social scales capture structural equivalences in biological hierarchies—mappings where interactions, organizations, and emergences preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical integrations, communication networks, and self-organizing regulations, validated via systems theory (e.g., Bertalanffy's isomorphisms across biology and social sciences, per web:8) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., cellular sociology to social structures). Hard-to-vary invariants like part-whole recursions enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm hierarchy/deny flatness/both in networks/neither in emergences); scores >0.98 based on 2025 biological abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to cellular, organism, social scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and biological overlays (e.g., cell signaling to social communication).
Validate coverage across scales (cellular → organism → social); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum-social links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., eusociality); integrate diachronic depth (prehistoric cells to modern societies).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
